meanings.definition: To travel by getting free rides in passing vehicles.
meanings.sent1: Yesterday, I hitchhiked to the beach and saved money on transportation.
meanings.sent2: She often hitchhiked to work when her car broke down.
meanings.sent3: The cat hitchhiked on the back of the dog to sneak into the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: His dreams hitchhiked on the winds of change, seeking new horizons.
meanings.sent5: The idea of hitchhiking through Europe seemed adventurous and thrilling.

meanings.sent1: Last summer, we hitchhiked across the country and had amazing adventures.
meanings.sent2: They hitchhiked to the concert and arrived just in time.
meanings.sent3: The teddy bear hitchhiked in the toy car, pretending to be a driver.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter hitchhiked through the room, spreading joy to everyone.
meanings.sent5: The memories of their journey hitchhiked into their hearts, forever cherished.
